WVRR200101-d-02-24-01-WVRR.Narrative: ON FEBRUARY 24, 2001, THE WVRR MECHANICAL DEPARTMENT WAS WORKING ON EQUIPMENT ON YARD TRACK #1 UNDERBLUE FLAG PROTECTION.  THIS EQUIPMENT CONSISTED OF (NORTH TO SOUTH):  WVRR ENGINE 25, MOFW REEFER VRTX 37214, CABOOSE NKP 759, HOPPER CAR NKP 64370.  AT 3:25 PM ONE OF THE WORKERS WAS ALERTED BY A PASSING AUTOMOBILE'S HORN.  LOOKING NORTH, HE SPOTTED THREE RUNAWAY BOXCARS APPROACHING RAPIDLY.  HE SHOUTED WARNINGS TO THE OTHER WORKERS.  ALL WORKERS MOVED AWAY FROM THE EQUIPMENT WITH THE EXCEPTIONOF ONE WHO WAS ON THE WALKWAY OF WVRR 25, WHERE HE TOOK TIGHTLY A HOLD OF THE HANDRAIL.  AT AN ESTIMATED SPEED OF 25 MPH THREE HI-CUBE BOXCARS COLLIDED WITH THE STANDING EQUIPMENT, PUSHING IT 80 FEETDOWN THE TRACK.  NO EQUIPMENT DERAILED AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  THE BRAKE PIPE HOSE CONNECTION BETWEEN THE SOUTHERNMOST AND MIDDLE BOXCARS WAS NOT CONNECTED.  NO HANDBRAKES WERE APPLIED.  WVRR 25SUSTAINED SEVERE DAMAGE TO THE REAR COUPLER, COUPLER CARRIER, END PLATE, CUT LEVER, PIPING, AND PILOT PLATE.  CABOOSE NKP 759 SUSTAINED DAMAGE INCLUDING FRAME BUCKLING.  ACCORDING TO THE C&NC RAILROAD, THE TRAIN BROKE APART DURING SWITCHING AT THE CONNECTING TRACK OF THE TWO RAILROADS.NoneNoneNone

G4958-d-02-03-01-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, THE 1500 SN WAS SWITCHING 53 TRACK HOLDING ONTO A CUT OF 23 CARS.THE FIRST CAR WAS KICKED UP THE LEAD FOR 36 TRACK.  THE NEXT CAR WENT TOWARDS 30 TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN KICKED TCIX 72683 UP THE LEAD TO CLEAR 30 TRACK AND WAS GOING TO KICK SIRX 380193 INTO 30TRACK, THEN GO BACK TO GET TCIX 72683 AND SHOVE 36 TRACK.  HOWEVER, TCIX 72683 ONLY ROLLED AS FAR AS32 TRACK ON THE LEAD BEFORE IT ROLLED BACK AND CORNERED SIRX 380193 AT THE CLEARANCE  POINT ON 30 TRACK.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR HAD NOT MADE SURE THAT TCIX 72683 WAS IN THE CLEAR BEFORE KICKING SIRX 380193 THUS CAUSING THE SIDESWIPES.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED IN THEIMPACT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4959-d-02-05-01-WC.Narrative: TRAIN XOSTES, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 92 LOADED ORE CARS WAS TRAVELING AT 32 MPH UNDER TWC ON MAIN LINE TRACK IN WOODBORO.  THE CREW NOTICED SPARKS AND STOPPED TO INSPECT THEIR TRAIN.  WHEN AROLL-BY WAS STARTED THEY FOUND THE LEAD SET OF TRUCKS ON CNW 2415 HAD DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTOTHE INCIDENT FOUND THAT A COMBINATION OF OVERSPEED WITH A LOADED ORE TRAIN ON THIS TRACK ALONG WITHDEFECTIVE SNUBBING OF CNW 2415 WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.  THE DOWNLOADED SPEED WAS 32 MPH WHICH EXCEEDED THE 25 MPH TRACK SPEED FOR THIS TRAIN.  THE REAR HELPER UNIT LEFT IN RUN 8 ALSO CONTRIBUTED TO THE OVERSPEED. THE CAR DERAILED AT MILEPOST 206.8 AND THE TRAIN STOPPED AT MILEPOST 208.0 WHICH CAUSED EXTENSIVE TRACK DAMAGE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G5101-d-02-09-01-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN BRFD1T-09 WAS TO DOUBLE UP BRC TRACKS 31, 32, AND 33 FROM THE WEST END OF THE BRC WEST DEPARTURE YARD.  THE WEST YARDMASTER TOLD THE CREW TO DOUBLE UP 31 TO 33 AND SHOVE IT IN THE CLEAR.  THEWEST UTILITY MAN WAS TO LINE THE EAST END OF THE YARD OF TRACK 33 FOR THE LEAD.  BRFD1T-09 THEN DOUBLED TRACK 32 BACK TO 33, GOT AN AIR TEST AND WAS JUST STARTING TO PULL UP TO THE SIGNAL AT 65TH STREET WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  IT WAS FOUND THAT ACFX 16933 HAD SPLIT THE SWITCH ON THE EAST END OF TRACK 33 AND DERAILED ITSELF AND 7 OTHER CARS.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THATTHE SWITCH HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY RUN THROUGH BY UNKNOWN INDIVIDUALS THUS CAUSING THE TRAIN TO DERAILWHEN IT PULLED THROUGH IT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

164409-d-02-25-01-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track
164409-d-02-25-01-SOO.Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track
164409-d-02-25-01-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT 4708 HUMPING CARS TO TRACK C19 WHEN CAR NKCR 65894 DERAILED ON CROSSING RESULTING IN CARTO LEAN AND WHEELS TO COME OUT FROM UNDER WEST END AND CAR NKCR 65914 TO COME OFF CENTER.  DERAILEDCARS CAUSED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO  RETARDERS.  CAUSE DETERMINED TO BE  ICE AND SNOW ON TRACK AND IN FLANGEWAY.  BRIEF DESCRIPTION: AN EMPTY BOX CAR DERAILED ON A CROSSING THAT IS USED TO MAINTAIN THE HUMP YARD SWITCHES AND RETARDERS AT THE ST PAUL HUMP. THE CAR DID EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE 2ND GROUP RETARDER BRAKING CYLINDERS AND THE CONTROL UNIT WAS DAMAGED BEYOND REPAIR.    FINAL CAUSE:  ICE AND SNOW BUILD UP ON THE MAINTENANCE CROSSING.  ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT:  THE ACCUMULATION OF SEVERAL EVENTS LEAD TO THE BUILD UP OF ICE AND SNOW ON THE CROSSING. THE WEATHER CONDITIONS WERE VERY POOR. THEREWAS A BUILD UP OF ICE DUE TO FREEZING RAIN AND ON TOP OF THAT THERE WERE SEVERAL INCHES OF HEAVY WET SNOW. THERE WERE TWO POWER OUTAGES DURING THE DAY.  DURING THE POWER OUTAGES THE HUMP WAS OUT OF SERVICE.  THE NORMAL HUMPING OPERATION USUALLY KEEPS THE MAINTENANCE CROSSING FREE OF ICE AND SNOW.THERE WAS ALSO VEHICLE TRAFFIC OVER THE MAINTENANCE CROSSING THAT FURTHER COMPACTED THE ICE AND SNOW. THE FIRST CAR THAT WAS HUMPED WAS AN EMPTY CAR.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION #1:  SECTION CREW TO MAINTAIN AND KEEP ALL CROSSINGS FREE OF ICE AND SNOW.   THEY WILL TREAT CROSSING WITH CALCIUM CHORIDE.  CONTRIBUTING FACTOR #1:  HEAVY EQUIPMENT OPERATORS ARE RELUCTANT TO CLEAN OR WORK ON

FEB200101-d-02-09-01-PTRA.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
FEB200101-d-02-09-01-PTRA.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
FEB200101-d-02-09-01-PTRA.Narrative: JOB 252 COUPLED INTO TRACK 62 ON THE SOUTH END OF NORTH YARD.  TRACK 62 HAD TWO UNION PACIFIC UNITSON SOUTH END PLUS 98 CARS.  JOB 252 TIED TWO UP ENGINES INTO MULTIPLE UNIT CONSIST WITH THEIR TWO SWITCHING UNITS THEN DRUG TRK 62 OUT SOUTH END ONTO THE 107 SWITCHING LEAD (EAST MAIN).  THEY SWUNG TRAIN OVER TO THE E&F YARD ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE NORTH YARD, TO BEGIN SWITCHING THEIR TRAIN.  THEY KICKED ONE CAR TO TRK 42, THEN KICKED ONE CAR TO TRK 43, DRUG BACK SOUTH AND SHOVED ONE CAR NORTHINTO TRK 33, SHOVING IT ALL THEY WAY TO THE NORTH END.  THEY THEN DRUG BACK SOUTH AND PROCEEDED TOKICK ONE CAR INTO TRK 43.  THEIR NEXT MOVE WAS TO KICK ONE CAR INTO TRK 40.  FOREMAN GAVE KICKING COMMAND, THERE WAS A 5-6 SECOND DELAY DURING WHICH CARS ON END NEAR FOREMAN DID NOT MOVE, SO FOREMAN GAVE A SECOND KICKING COMMAND.  ENGINE CONTINUED TO ACCELERATE AND WHEN HIS SPEED REACHED POINT HE FELT HE WOULD HAVE TROUBLE STOPPING HIS MOVEMENT, HE BEGAN BACKING OFF THE THROTTLE.  IT WAS AT THIS MOMENT THAT HEAD-END PORTION OF HIS TRAIN RAN INTO REAR-END PORTION WHICH HAD BECAME SEPARATED DUE TODRAWBAR BEING TORN OUT OF 43RD CAR FROM ENGINE DURING  STOPPING MOVEMENT FROM PRECEDING KICKING MOVEMENT INTO TRK 43.  CARS DERAILED, OVER TURNED AND STRUCK CARS SITTING ON SOUTH END OF TRK 60, TURNING OVER TWO SOUTH MOST CARS IN TRK 60.None
